translation.ko: 난 오늘부터 성인이니까 내 일은 내가 결정할 수 있어

translation.en: and I have decided that I am staying here.
-[screaming] Put me down, put me down! -[Danny] Hey. Come on. Hey.
Ronnie! [screaming]
That is some amazing parenting right there.
-[Stacy] No! Don't! [screaming] -[Danny] Hey.
Hey, how are those armpits doing?
You know how they say that it grows back double?
translation.ko: 제모하면 새 털이 두 배로 난다는 말 있잖아

translation.en: It's growing back triple. Oh.
translation.ko: - 난 세 배로 나고 있어 - 어떡해

translation.en: Yeah.
-[Stacy screaming] -[Bree] Pull it together!
-[Danny] Calm down. -I don't want to go.
Can you stop?

translation.en: H-hey! Hey! Hey! Hey!
Shabbat shalom.
Today is a very special day.
Our brilliant, young Stacy Friedman
is called to the bimah for her Bat Mitzvah.
[Stacy, narrating] Oh, God.
Do you hear her calling me up to receive an honor I do not deserve?
translation.ko: 랍비님이 자격도 없는 저를 이 귀한 자리로 불렀어요

translation.en: I've been dreaming about this day my whole life, and now it's here.
And I wish I could go back in bed, or under my bed, or literally anywhere--
translation.ko: 침대에 콕 박혀 있고만 싶어요 아니면 침대 밑에 숨거나요 여기 빼고 어디든지요

translation.en: [Rebecca] Seema?
asher bachar banu mikol…
[Stacy slowing] ha-amim…
I made a huge mistake. [sniffling]
I'm sorry. I don't even know what I'm doing up here.
In the Jewish religion, I am supposed to be a grown-up today.
But I have been so selfish and bratty and annoying to my parents who just want…
translation.ko: 근데 전 너무 이기적이고 부모님한테 반항하면서 속을 썩이기만…

translation.en: [Stacy, narrating] And then, it happened.
The very day I was supposed to become a woman
translation.ko: 내가 성인 여성이 되는 바로 이날

translation.en: is the day that everything started to make sense.
…Nikki, Tara…
When you're a kid, you think it's okay to put yourself in front of your friends
in pursuit of something better.
translation.ko: 더 좋은 걸 따라가도 된다고 생각한다

translation.en: A woman knows there is nothing better than your friends.
translation.ko: 하지만 성인 여성은 친구보다 더 좋은 건 없단 걸 안다

translation.en: …Kym, Megan, Anya…
[Stacy, narrating] When you're a kid,
sometimes you think you have to be someone you're not in order to fit in.
translation.ko: 주변에 어울리려면 가끔은 가식적이어야 한다고 생각한다

translation.en: …if I'm being honest, it's probably 'cause we were, like, jealous or something…
But a woman knows it's not about hiding who you are.
translation.ko: 하지만 성인 여성은 자신을 숨겨선 안 되고

translation.en: It's about being yourself and speaking your truth.
…but also, you guys can be, like, such a-holes sometimes.
translation.ko: 근데 너희 가끔 겁나 개싸가지인 거 알지?

translation.en: Keep it PG in the temple.
Sorry.
Where'd she learn to curse like that?
No idea.
[Stacy] And the biggest difference between being a kid and an adult…
Andy…
…is knowing what really matters.
translation.ko: 진짜 중요한 게 뭔지 아는 거다

translation.en: I'm gonna keep it brief 'cause I know you can't focus on one thing for that long,
translation.ko: 짧게 끝낼게, 너 원래 한 가지에 오래 집중 못 하잖아

translation.en: but you're basic and not nice to people,
translation.ko: 넌 평범 그 자체에 사람들 배려도 안 하고

translation.en: [Aaron] You suck!

translation.ko: 나한테 제일 소중한 친구와의 우정을 망치게 된 거야

Hey, hey, hey… You gotta go up there and finish your Torah portion before you go.

translation.en: Come here. Give it your best shot, and then we'll all fix this together.
translation.ko: 자, 일단 하는 데까지 해봐 그러고 나서 힘을 합쳐 해결해 보자

translation.en: Hopefully, after I take off this itchy suit.
You have coffee breath.
Okay. All right. Use that up there. Go.

translation.en: Quickly, so quickly, so quickly.
So quickly.
I did it.
Ya'sher koach! Now go!
[Stacy] Lydia!
[panting] Lydia.
Lydia.
Lydia, please open--
The Andy stuff.
I know you never hurt me on purpose.

translation.en: I should have let you apologize.
I miss you, and I love you, and I'm sorry.

translation.en: Stacy, you ruined my Bat Mitzvah.
What part of that do you not understand? I don't under-- Like--

translation.en: -I know. -Let me finish.
That day at the ledge, I told you not to go.
translation.ko: 절벽에 갔던 날도 난 가지 말자고 했었어

translation.en: I told you don't jump. You jumped.
Then the whole thing ended up being my fault.
-Then I was the shitty friend? -I'm sorry.
And I've known you liked Andy for, like, a million years, but guess what, Stacy?
translation.ko: 네가 백만 년 전부터 앤디 좋아한 거 알아 근데 말이야

translation.en: So has every other girl at our school, including me,
translation.ko: 우리 학교 여자애들 다 그랬어 나 포함해서

translation.en: but I never told you anything because I knew it'd just make you upset.
translation.ko: 근데 네가 신경 쓸까 봐 말 안 했던 거야

translation.en: And then, when you uninvited me to the day I've been helping you plan forever,
translation.ko: 내가 그 예전부터 준비하는 걸 도왔는데도 네 바트 미츠바에 오지 말라고 한 건 또 어떻고?

translation.en: I dated him to make you mad.
Until you ruined it.

Wait, you're right.
Yeah, I know.

Hello, again.
Honey?
Hi, Mom.
[Bree] Your father called in a lot of favors.
I think it's gonna work out if she shows up.
Come on. Let me do it.
I know tonight's not exactly what you dreamed it would be,

Okay, go.
[Bree] There.
-[Stacy] Hmm. -Gorgeous.
[in accent] Thanks, doll.

[gasping] Really?
Thank you!
I think I'm gonna wear sneakers.
Oh my God, you're a woman. You're a smart woman

I made it.
Perfect timing.
Just in time for your grand entrance.

No, Lydia…
Please give a very sweet welcome to your Bat Mitzvah

[Stacy] It's time for yours.
Stacy, what is this?

It's our dream.
Stacy!
Yeah, Lydia! We love you!
We love you!
Go!
Okay.
[Stacy] Entrance. Beautiful.
[Schmuley] Lydia! Lydia! Lydia! [crowd] Lydia!

translation.en: I'm kidding you. You're good. We got this.

Guys, you're watching Shawshank Redemp! [chuckling]
-I love that movie. Have you seen-- -[both] Yeah, we've seen it.

translation.en: -Yeah, can you leave us alone? -[both] Bye!
You're the guy from the movie theater, right? I am.
Let me get some Twizzlers.
-Yeah, give me a lot. -[man] On it.
-I just want one. -Okay, my bad.
Hell's wrong with you?
All right, mishpachalah!
Who's ready for some "Don't Stop Believing!"?

translation.en: Yeah, let's go!
Of course you are, nerd, and that's why I'm not going to play it.

[Mateo] Hey.
Do you want to dance?
Well, what about Isabella?
Who?
Your 25-year-old girlfriend back in Ecuador?
I just assumed her name was something glamorous like Isabella.

translation.en: I don't have a girlfriend.
You know, it's a weird rumor I don't understand.

translation.en: [gasping] Ooh, how do you feel about that?
Your daughter's dancing with a handsome young gentleman?
Um, surprisingly, I feel okay with it. Really?
-You know what I don't feel good with? -What?
translation.ko: - 안 괜찮은 게 따로 있거든 - 뭔데?

translation.en: -Rabbi Rebecca and Cantor Jerry. -[Bree gasping]
[Danny] What is that?
[Bree] Ooh, work it, Rabbi.
Yeah. That should be against every religion right there.
translation.ko: 저건 세상 어느 종교도 용납 못 할 광경이야

translation.en: -Yeah. [laughing] -What are they doing?
Okay, that's enough of the slow stuff.
-Let's make some noise everybody! -[crowd cheering]
Are you ready?
[Stacy, narrating] Dear God, Stacy Friedman here.
So today, I'm an adult,
and honestly, it's wonderful.
I know this is just the first chapter of my grown-up life,

translation.en: and it might not always be this great,

translation.en: I mean, no pressure.
Not like I could pressure you.
Just saying.
And I know what you're thinking,

translation.en: But that's not a mitzvah.
That's just being a best friend.
♪ Yeah, turn it up ♪
Welcome to Mitzvah Bakery. All proceeds go to charity.
translation.ko: "미츠바 빵집 베스 정의의 시너고그" 미츠바 빵집에 잘 오셨어요 수익금은 전액 자선 활동에 쓰여요

translation.en: [Stacy] Helping others, being selfless, taking the bad and making it good…
translation.ko: 남을 돕고, 이기심을 버리고 나쁜 걸 좋게 만들고…

translation.en: -Breadsticks for four dollars. -Four dollars.
[Stacy] That's a mitzvah.
[girl] Stacy, you did this?
-This is so dope. -What are you gonna get?
[Stacy] Okay, obviously you know that. You're God, which you also know.

translation.en: Make sure you say Hamotzi.
And for one piece, 24 dollars.
[Stacy] Anyway, thanks for being patient with me.
I'm really glad I'm a part of this.

translation.en: -Ooh, thank you. -You're welcome.
You're very, very welcome!
[Stacy] Okay, I'll get back to you. Selling bread.

translation.en: Now we're talking mitzvah!
